intro: Callicarpa nishimurae, commonly known as the Nishimura beautyberry, is a deciduous shrub native to Japan. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its clusters of small, bright purple berries that ripen in the fall. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters and features opposite, ovate leaves with a glossy texture. Its flowers are small, white, and clustered in umbels, appearing in late spring. The berries are not only ornamental but also serve as a food source for birds and other wildlife.
